title: Tom Phillips shooting: NZ police race to find children before nightfall after fugitive father shot dead by police – latest updates
summary: A fugitive father, on the run with his children for four years, was shot by police following an attempted burglary in Piopio. Authorities are now actively searching for two of his missing children. The incident has raised concerns about their safety and well-being.

title: Country diary: Dark chocolate butterflies in a purple patch | Amanda Thomson
summary: In Abernethy Forest within the Cairngorms, Scotch Argus butterflies are actively fluttering around the expansive heather fields. These butterflies are characterized by their velvety brown wings adorned with an orange band. Their presence highlights the rich biodiversity of the area.

title: Tanni Grey-Thompson received ‘abusive’ emails over opposition to assisted dying bill
summary: A cross-bench peer acknowledges that both support and hostility have emerged regarding a particular issue. They emphasize the importance of engaging in "really detailed discussion" to address the matter effectively. The call for dialogue highlights the complexity and differing perspectives involved.

title: Tate Modern to host Tracey Emin’s biggest ever exhibition next spring
summary: "A Second Life" will showcase the artwork "My Bed" along with new pieces highlighting the artist's journey through cancer. The exhibition aims to provide a profound reflection on personal struggles and resilience. This collection promises to offer fresh insights into the artist's experiences and emotions.
